### Larry (Gengyan) Liu
I'm a senior Physics major at Pomona College with extensive experience in mechanical design, fluid dynamics research, and innovative engineering projects. From designing a tracked electric platform with two-speed transmission to simulating and experimenting vortex ring formation in Sphagnum moss, I've pursued my passion for creating sophisticated mechanical systems throughout my undergraduate career.

<p style="text-align: center; display: flex; align-items: center; justify-content: center;">
  <img src="images/larry_headshot.jpeg" alt="Headshot" style="width: 200px; height: 200px; border-radius: 50%; vertical-align: middle; margin: 0 10px;">
</p>

*My journey in mechanical design began in my freshman year, driven by a deep fascination with designing and building functional mechanical systems. Though I wish I had formal mechanical design education earlier, the self-taught path has given me unique perspectives and problem-solving approaches. My work spans from non planar superconducting stellarator magnets to amphibious robots and shaped charge simulations, reflecting my diverse interests in applied physics and engineering.*

**Future Plans:** *I'm excited to continue my academic journey as a Kummer I&E Doctoral Fellow at Missouri S&T, where I'll advance research in energetic materials safety and applications.*
